titleStmt.title: A. J. Wright et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4446

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thos E Bramlett Governor of of Kentucky.

Your petitioners would respectfully represent that Wm P Adcock was at the October term of the Trimble Circuit Court, fined two hundred and fifty dollars, for suffering gaming in his hous. the proof upon the trial proved that there was but one game played in this house at five cents anty, the proof did Not Show that he W. P. Adcock did or did not know whether any gaming in his house was going on. Mr Adcock is unable to pay the fine as above and we your petitioners would respectfully pray that the Same be remitted as far as it is in your power to do So.

A. J. Wright
T M McCarty
L. Milner
Allard C Yeager
J. H. Currace
J. B. Pierce
J. T. Ladd MD
W. P. Maddox
J. T. Hicks
